title: General Knowledge Quiz XII (50 Questions)
description: Challenging but fair across film/TV, games, architecture, chemistry, and island/seas geography. No sports content.

items.q: Who directed the film Spirited Away (2001)?
items.a: Hayao Miyazaki - Studio Ghibli film that won the 2003 Academy Award for Best Animated Feature

items.q: Which TV series features the law firm Pearson Specter Litt?
items.a: Suits - legal drama set in New York City

items.q: What is the highest‑grossing film of all time (worldwide, not adjusted for inflation)?
items.a: Avatar - James Cameron’s 2009 sci‑fi epic (surpassed earlier records)

items.q: Which actress played Ellen Ripley in the Alien franchise?
items.a: Sigourney Weaver - iconic sci‑fi action hero

items.q: Which 1999 film popularized bullet‑time action sequences?
items.a: The Matrix - directed by the Wachowskis

items.q: What is the name of the coffee shop in Friends?
items.a: Central Perk - the gang’s frequent hangout in Manhattan

items.q: Who created the TV series The Twilight Zone (1959)?
items.a: Rod Serling - anthology exploring speculative fiction and morality

items.q: Which 2016 streaming series follows a young queen’s early reign?
items.a: The Crown - dramatization of Queen Elizabeth II’s life

items.q: Who directed Parasite (2019), the first non‑English Best Picture winner at the Oscars?
items.a: Bong Joon‑ho - South Korean dark comedy thriller

items.q: Which show features a chemistry teacher who becomes a meth manufacturer?
items.a: Breaking Bad - created by Vince Gilligan; character Walter White

items.q: Which board game involves building routes between cities with train cards?
items.a: Ticket to Ride - set collection and route‑building strategy

items.q: What 2017 video game by Nintendo features the kingdom of Hyrule in an open world?
items.a: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild - acclaimed open‑world design

items.q: Which board game uses polyomino tiles to fill a personal grid without gaps or overlaps?
items.a: Patchwork - two‑player game of quilting and time management

items.q: Which puzzle game involves matching falling geometric shapes to clear lines?
items.a: Tetris - created by Alexey Pajitnov in 1984

items.q: Which social deduction game asks players to find the impostor on a spaceship?
items.a: Among Us - online multiplayer hit by Innersloth (2018)

items.q: Which tabletop role‑playing game uses a twenty‑sided die as its core mechanic?
items.a: Dungeons & Dragons - first published in 1974

items.q: Which indie game tasks you with exploring a mysterious island while solving panel puzzles?
items.a: The Witness - 2016 puzzle game by Jonathan Blow

items.q: Which cooperative board game has players cure outbreaks across the globe?
items.a: Pandemic - team‑based strategy by Matt Leacock

items.q: Which game popularized the battle royale genre with last‑person‑standing matches?
items.a: PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds (PUBG) - 2017 release influencing many successors

items.q: Which deck‑building card game has players acquire copper, silver, and gold?
items.a: Dominion - seminal deck‑builder by Donald X. Vaccarino

items.q: Which Mughal mausoleum in Agra is famed for its white marble and symmetry?
items.a: Taj Mahal - built by Shah Jahan for Mumtaz Mahal (completed 1653)

items.q: Which Parisian tower was built for the 1889 Exposition Universelle?
items.a: The Eiffel Tower - designed by Gustave Eiffel’s company

items.q: Which New York statue was a gift from France dedicated in 1886?
items.a: Statue of Liberty - ‘Liberty Enlightening the World’ on Liberty Island

items.q: Which ancient Greek temple on the Acropolis honors Athena Parthenos?
items.a: The Parthenon - 5th‑century BCE Doric masterpiece

items.q: Which Incan citadel sits atop a mountain ridge near Cusco?
items.a: Machu Picchu - 15th‑century site rediscovered by Hiram Bingham in 1911

items.q: Which Roman amphitheater in Rome could hold tens of thousands of spectators?
items.a: The Colosseum - Flavian amphitheater completed in 80 CE

items.q: Which cathedral in Paris is famed for its flying buttresses and Gothic architecture?
items.a: Notre‑Dame de Paris - begun in the 12th century on Île de la Cité

items.q: Which massive stone heads are found on Rapa Nui (Easter Island)?
items.a: Moai - carved by the Rapa Nui people between c. 1100 and 1600 CE

items.q: Which Islamic shrine in Jerusalem features a gold‑colored dome over the Foundation Stone?
items.a: Dome of the Rock - completed in 691–692 CE

items.q: Which sandstone city in Jordan features the Treasury (Al‑Khazneh) façade?
items.a: Petra - Nabataean city accessed through the Siq

items.q: What is the lightest metal element?
items.a: Lithium - alkali metal with atomic number 3

items.q: Which polymer is commonly used in plastic bottles labeled PET?
items.a: Polyethylene terephthalate - polyester used in fibers and containers

items.q: What term describes a substance that speeds a chemical reaction without being consumed?
items.a: Catalyst - lowers activation energy, increasing reaction rate

items.q: Which gas is produced when acids react with carbonates (e.g., vinegar and baking soda)?
items.a: Carbon dioxide - effervescence from CO₂ release

items.q: What is the pH of a neutral aqueous solution at 25 °C?
items.a: 7 - equal concentrations of H⁺ and OH⁻

items.q: Which element’s allotropes include graphite, diamond, and graphene?
items.a: Carbon - forms sp²/sp³ structures with diverse properties

items.q: What process separates crude oil into components by boiling point?
items.a: Fractional distillation - yields fractions like gasoline and diesel

items.q: Which compound is commonly known as table sugar?
items.a: Sucrose - disaccharide of glucose and fructose

items.q: What is the main component of natural gas?
items.a: Methane - CH₄, the simplest hydrocarbon

items.q: Which metal is liquid at room temperature besides mercury?
items.a: None at standard room temperature (~20 °C); gallium (~29.8 °C) and cesium (~28.5 °C) melt just above room temperature

items.q: Which island nation lies off the southeastern coast of Africa in the Indian Ocean?
items.a: Madagascar - biodiversity hotspot with many endemic species

items.q: What strait separates the Arabian Peninsula from Africa at the Red Sea’s southern end?
items.a: Bab el‑Mandeb - connects the Red Sea to the Gulf of Aden

items.q: Which sea is bordered by Iran, Russia, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan, and Azerbaijan?
items.a: The Caspian Sea - largest inland body of water on Earth

items.q: Which island is home to the city of Reykjavik?
items.a: Iceland - North Atlantic island nation with geothermal energy

items.q: Which channel separates England and France?
items.a: The English Channel - known as La Manche in French

items.q: Which Indonesian island is famous for Komodo dragons?
items.a: Komodo - part of the Lesser Sunda chain, a national park

items.q: Which Caribbean nation shares Hispaniola with Haiti?
items.a: Dominican Republic - eastern side of the island

items.q: Which sea between Europe and Asia is connected to the Mediterranean via the Dardanelles and Bosporus?
items.a: The Black Sea - linked by Turkish straits

items.q: Which archipelago nation consists of more than 7,000 islands in Southeast Asia?
items.a: The Philippines - island nation in the western Pacific

items.q: Which island country in Oceania has Wellington as its capital?
items.a: New Zealand - main islands are North and South Island
